column4: I'd boot up into a live session with the Ubuntu CD, connect an external drive that is large enough to hold an image of your failing harddrive, then use ddrescue to store an image of the failing disk on the external drive.
Later on you can safely mount and copy out important stuff from that image.
It says so itself, and it's probably right. Harddrives don't last forever, and ones it's dead, getting data from it will be hard and expensive.
